JavaScript

Reference

About Javascript

Created by Netscape in 1995 as an extension of HTML for Netscape Navigator 2.0, JavaScript had as its main function the manipulation of HTML documents and form validation. Before winning this name so famous nowadays, JavaScript was called Mocha. When it first shipped in beta releases, it was officially called LiveScript and finally, when it was released by Sun Microsystems, was baptized with the name by which it is known today. Because of the similar names, people confuse JavaScript with Java. Although both have the lexical structure of programming, they are not the same language. Different from C, C# and Java, JavaScript is an interpreted language. It means that it needs an "interpreter". In case of JavaScript, the interpreter is the browser. The JavaScript standard is ECMAScript. As of 2012, all modern browsers fully support ECMAScript 5.1. Older browsers support at least ECMAScript 3. As of June 2015 the spec for ES6/ES2015 has been approved. See the ECMAScript 2015 Language Specification at Ecma International.

The DOM : The Document Object Model (DOM) is an API for HTML and XML documents. It provides a structural representation of the document, enabling you to modify its content and visual presentation by using a scripting language such as JavaScript. See more at Mozilla Developer Network - DOM.

Some Basics

Data Types :
Primitive Values :
String Ex:"Javascript"
Number Ex: 25
Boolean Ex: True || False
Null Variable has no Value
Undefined Default Datatype for Any Variable
 References Types :
Object Ex: {firstName: "Maged", lastName: "Mohamed", age: 21}
Array Ex: ["Maged", "Mohamed", 21]
Function Ex: function nameOfFunction (param1, param2) { //Code }
Date Describe The Date
RegExp A regular expression is an object that describes a pattern of characters. Ex: /pattern/modifiers;

Arithmetic Operators
( + ) : Addition
( - ) : Subtract
( * ) : Multiplication
( / ) : Division
( % ) : Modulus
( ++ ) : Increment
( -- ) : Decrement

Assignment Operators
( = ) : Equals Declare a Variable anywhere even in if Statement
( += ) : Add Value Over its value
( -= ) : Subtract Value Over its value
( *= ) : Multiply Value Over its value
( /= ) : Dive Value Over its value
( %= ) : Modules Value Over its value

Comparison and Logical Operators
( == ) : Equal To Compare a value of variable to other
( === ) : Equal Value and Equal Type
( != ) : NOT Equal
( !== ) : NOT Equal Value and NOT Equal Type
( > ) : Greater Than
( < ) : Less Than
( >= ) : Greater Than OR Equal
( =< ) : Less Than OR Equal
( ? ) : Ternary Operator
( && ) : And Operator
( || ) : Or Operator

Strings

Method Description Example
.length Returns the length of a string var x = "Maged";x.length //return 5
.toString() Returns the value of a String object, Convert Number to String var x = ["Hello World!", 21];console.log(x.toString()); // "Maged, 21"
.indexOf(value, Start Position) Returns the position of the FIRST found occurrence of a specified value in a string var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x.indexOf("o", 5)); // output 7
.lastIndexOf(value, Start Position) Returns the position of the LAST found occurrence of a specified value in a string var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x.lastIndexOf("o", 5)); // output 4
.search(/String/ig) Searches a string for a specified value, or regular expression[Case Sensitive], and returns the position of the match var x = "Mr. Blue has a blue mouse"; console.log(x.search("blue")); // output 15
.split(Separator, Limit) Splits a string into an array of substrings var x = "How Are You Today ?"; console.log(x.split("o", 2)); // output: H,w are y,
.slice(Start, End) Extracts a part of a string and returns a new string var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x.slic(2,6)); // output: llo W
.substr(Start, Length) Extracts the characters from a string, beginning at a specified start position, and through the specified number of character var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x.substr(0,4)); // output: Hell
.substring(Start, End) Extracts the characters from a string, between two specified indicesit's like slice(), but in slice method the first parameter can't be Greater Than The Second one var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x.substring(6, 2));// == substring(2, 6) // output: llo W
.charAt(index) Returns the character at the specified index (position) var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x..charAt(x.length-1)); // output: !
.charCodeAt(index) Returns the Unicode of the character at the specified index var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x..charCodeAt(0)); // output: 72
.replace(value, new value) Searches a string for a specified value, or a regular expression[Case Sensitive], and returns a new string where the specified values are replaced var x = "Hello World!"; console.log(x..replace("Hello", "Maged")); // output: Hello Maged!
String.fromCharCode(Num1, Num2, . . Num) Converts Unicode values to characters var x = String.fromCharCode(72, 69, 76, 76, 79); console.log(x); // output: HELLO
.concat(String1, string2) Joins two or more strings, and returns a new joined strings var x = "Hello", y = "World !"; console.log(x.concat(y)); // output: Hello World!
.toLowerCase() Converts a string to lowercase letters var x = "Hello World !"; console.log(x.toLowerCase()); // output: hello world!
.toUpperCase() Converts a string to upper letters var x = "Hello World !"; console.log(x.toLowerCase()); // output: HELLO WORLD!
.trim() Removes whitespace from both ends of a string var x = "       Hello World!        "; console.log(x.trim()); // output: Hello World!
.link("http://....") Displays a string as a hyperlink var x = "Fb.Com"; console.log(x.link("http://facebook.com/Maged.AbdelWahab")); // output: Fb.Com

Numbers

64-Bit Floating Point Numbers
Method Description Example
.toExponential(x) Converts a number into an exponential notation var x = 5.56789; console.log(x.toExponential(3)); //output 5.568e+0
.toFixed(x) Formats a number with x numbers of digits after the decimal point var x = 5.56789; console.log(x.toFixed(2)); //output 5.57
.parseInt(x) function parses a string and returns an integer var x = "100px"; console.log(x.parseInt()); //output 100

Boolean

Method Description Example
Boolean(Statement) To Figure out whether the statement is True or False var x = Boolean(5 > 10); console.log(x); //output False
Boolean.valueOf() Returns the primitive value of a boolean var x = true; console.log(x.valueOf()); //output true

Arrays

Method Description Example
.isArray() Checks whether an object is an array var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; console.log(x.isArray()); //output true
.toString() Converts an array to a string, and returns the result var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; console.log(x.toString()); //output Mitsubishi,Chevrolet,Nissan
.push() Adds new elements to the END of an array, and returns the new length
Another Way to push Element: x[x.length] = "Nissan";		 var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet"]; x.push("Nissan"); console.log(x); //output ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]
.unshift() Adds new elements to the BEGINNING of an array, and returns the new length var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet"]; x.unshift("Nissan"); console.log(x); //output ["Nissan", "Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet"]
.splice(index, How Many, pushItem1, pushItem2 . .) Adds/Removes elements from an array How Many : Required. The number of items to be removed. If set to 0, no items will be removed var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; x.splice(1, 1, "Ferrari","Mercedes"); console.log(x); //output ["Mitsubishi", "Ferrari", "Mercedes", "Nissan"]
.pop() Removes the LAST element of an array, and returns that element var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; x.pop(); console.log(x); //output ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet"]
.shift() Removes the FIRST element of an array, and returns that element var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; x.pop(); console.log(x); //output ["Chevrolet", "Nissan"]
.sort() Sorts the elements of an array, The sort order can be either alphabetic or numeric, and either ascending (up) or descending (down). Read More var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; x.sort(); console.log(x); //output ["Chevrolet", "Mitsubishi","Nissan"]
.reverse() Reverses the order of the elements in an array var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; x.sort(); console.log(x); //output ["Nissan", "Mitsubishi","Chevrolet"]
.slice(Start, End) Selects a part of an array, and returns the NEW ARRAY var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"]; console.log(x.slice(1, 2)); //output ["Mitsubishi"]
.concat() Joins two or more arrays, and returns a copy of the joined arrays var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan"], y = ["Ferrari", "Mercedes"]; console.log(x.concat(y)); //output ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan","Ferrari", "Mercedes"]
.indexOf(Item, Start Index) Search the array for an element and returns its position var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan", "Chevrolet"]; console.log(x.indexOf("Chevrolet", 2)); //output 3
.lastIndexOf(Item, Start Index) Search the array for an element, starting at the end, and returns its position var x = ["Mitsubishi", "Chevrolet", "Nissan", "Chevrolet"]; console.log(x.lastIndexOf("Chevrolet", 2)); //output 1

Date


Full Format : October 25, 1982 09:20:50
Long Format : Oct 25 1982
Short Format : 10/25/1982 09:20:50
ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss+TZD

Method Description Example
.getDate() Returns the day of the month (from 1-31) var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getDate(); //output
.getFullYear() Returns the Year var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getDay(); //output
.getMonth() Returns the month (from 0-11) Junuary is 0, February is 1, and so on var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getMonth(); //output
.getDay() Returns the day of the week (from 0-6) Sunday is 0, Monday is 1, and so on. var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getDay(); //output
.getHours() Returns the hour (from 0-23) var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getHours(); //output
.getMinutes() Returns the minutes (from 0-59) var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getMinutes(); //output
.getSeconds() Returns the Seconds (from 0-59) var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getSeconds(); //output
.getMilliseconds() Returns the Milliseconds (from 0-999) var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getMilliseconds(); //output
.getTime() Returns the number of milliseconds since midnight Jan 1 1970epoch, and a specified date var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getTime(); //output
.getTimezoneOffset() Returns the time difference between UTC time and local time, in minutes var x = new Date(); console.log(x.getTimezoneOffset(); //output
The SET Methods , Just replace get with set [setTime()] , It's the same meaning
And All That Methods By Adding UTC after get/set [getUTCDay() / setUTCDay()] you will get/set the result in Universal Time Coordinates
.now() Returns the number of milliseconds since midnight Jan 1, 1970The Difference Between now() and getTime() , That is getTime() Will tell the time at the point of the variable was set. However, now() Will get the time current now --> The best is now() var x = new Date.now(); console.log(x) ; //output
.parse("") Parses a date string and returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 till Specific Date var x = new Date.parse("Aug 5, 2016"); console.log(x) ; //output
.toISOString() Returns the date as a string, using the ISO standard var x = new Date(); console.log(x.toISOString(); //output
.toDateString() Converts the date portion of a Date object into a readable string var x = new Date(); console.log(x.toDateString(); //output
.toTimeString() Converts the time portion of a Date object to a string var x = new Date(); console.log(x.toTimeString(); //output

Math Object

Method Description Example
Math.ceil(x) Returns x, rounded UPWARDS to the nearest integer var x = 1.4; console.log(Math.ceil(x)); //output 2
Math.floor(x) Returns x, rounded DOWNWARDS to the nearest integer var x = 1.7; console.log(Math.floor(x)); //output 1
Math.round(x) Rounds x to the nearest integer var x = 1.4; console.log(Math.round(x)); //output 1
Math.min(x, y, z, ...) Returns the number with the lowest value var x = 4, y = 6; console.log(Math.min(x, y)); //output 4
Math.max(x, y, z, ...) Returns the number with the highest value var x = 4, y = 6; console.log(Math.min(x, y)); //output 6
Math.random() Returns a random number between 0 and 1 var x = Math.floor(Math.random() * 100 + 1); console.log(x); //output
Other Known Methods : sin(), cos(), tan(), log(), pow(), sqrt()

Global Ref.

Method Description Example
eval(string) Evaluates a string and executes it as if it was script code var x = eval("5 * 5"); console.log(x); //output 25
isNaN() Determines whether a value is an illegal number var x = isNaN(0 / 0); console.log(x); //output false
Number() Converts an object's value to a number var x = true; console.log(Number(x)); //output 1
String() Converts an object's value to a number var x = Boolean(0); console.log(Sting(x)); //output true

Regular Expression

A regular expression is an object that describes a pattern of characters.
Regular expressions are used to perform pattern-matching and "search-and-replace" functions on text.

Document Object Model

DOM Document
Method Description jQuery Equivalent
Finding HTML Elements
document.getElementById(id) Find an element by element id $('#ID')
document.getElementsByTagName(name) Find elements by tag name $('name')
document.getElementsByClassName(name) Find elements by class name $('.class')
document.querySelectorAll() Returns a static NodeListArray containing all elements that matches a specified CSS selector(s) in the document $('selector')
Adding and Deleting Elements
document.createElement() Creates an Element node $(document.createElement('div')) This is The Best Way !
document.createTextNode() Creates a Text node $('selector').append(document.createTextNode())
document.createAttribute("attribute") Creates an attribute node $("selector").attr("attrivute","value");
element.removeChild()Unknown Parent : child.parentNode.removeChild(child) Removes a child node from an element $(element).empty()
element.appendChild() Adds a new CHILD node, to an element, as the last child node $(element).append()
element.insertBefore(newnode, existingnode) Inserts a new child node before a specified, existing, child node $(contentToBeInserted).insertBefore(target)
element.replaceChild(newnode,oldnode) Replaces a child node in an element .replaceWith(newContent)
document.write() Writes HTML expressions or JavaScript code to a document mostly used for testing $(document.body).append('hello');
HTML Objects
document.URL Returns the full URL of the HTML document $(location).attr("href");
document.lastModified Returns the date and time the document was updated
document.head Returns the <head> element
document.title Returns the <title> element
-= Full HTML Objects =-
HTML Elements
Method Description jQuery Equivalent
Traversing HTML Nodes & Elements
element.parentNode() Returns the parent node of an element $('element').parent()
element.childNodes[nodenumber] Returns a collection of an element's child nodes (including text and comment nodes) .contents()[]
element.firstChild Returns the first child node of an element .contents()[0]
element.lastChild Returns the last child node of an element .contents()[contents.length - 1]
element.nextSibling Returns the next NODE at the same node tree level Rarely to found method that Traverse DOM NODES !!
element.previousSibling Returns the previous NODE at the same node tree level Rarely to found method that Traverse DOM NODES !!
element.firstElementChild Returns the first child Element of an element element.first()
element.lastElementChild Returns the last child Element of an element element.last()
element.nextElementSibling Returns the next Element at the same node tree level .next()
element.previousElementSibling Returns the previous Element at the same node tree level .prev()
element.hasChildNodes() Returns true if an element has any child nodes, otherwise false if ( $(element).children().length > 0 ) {// do something}
element.cloneNode(deep) Clone an Element. || deep value: true|false. Optional. Specifies whether all descendants of the node should be cloned. .clone()
Elements Properties
element.innerHTML Sets or returns the content of an element .html(html string)
element.textContent Sets or returns the textual content of a node and its descendants .text(html string)
element.getAttribute() Returns the specified attribute value of an element node .attr(attribute)
element.setAttribute(attributename,attributevalue) Sets or changes the specified attribute, to the specified value .attr(attributeName, attributeValue)
element.hasAttribute() Returns true if an element has the specified attribute, otherwise false Return True/False Has No Equivalent
element.removeAttribute() Removes a specified attribute from an element .removeAttr( attributeName )
element.classList Returns the class name(s) of an element Has No Equivalent
element.classList.item(index) Returns the class name with a specified index number from an element. Index starts at 0. Returns null if the index is out of range Has No Equivalent
element.classList.contains(class) Returns a Boolean value, indicating whether an element has the specified class name. .hasClass( className )
element.classList.add(class1, class2, ...) Adds one or more class names to an element. If the specified class already exist, the class will not be added .addClass( className/function )
element.classList.remove(class1, class2, ...) Removes one or more class names from an element. Removing a class that does not exist, does NOT throw an error .removeClass( [className ] )
element.classList.toggle(class, true|false) Toggles between a class name for an element. The optional second parameter is a Boolean value that forces the class to be added or removed, regardless of whether or not it already existed. False->Remove | True->Add .toggleClass( className )
element.focus() Gives focus to an element Has No Equivalent
element.blur() Removes focus from an element Has No Equivalent
element.click() Simulates a mouse-click on an element Has No Equivalent
element.contains(node) Returns true if a node is a descendant of a node, otherwise false .contains( container, contained )
element.clientHeight returns in pixels : VISIBLE content & padding | but not the border, scrollbar or margin. clientHeight can be calculated as CSS height + CSS padding - height of horizontal scrollbar (if present)
element.clientWidth returns in pixels : VISIBLE content & padding | but not the border, scrollbar or margin. clientWidth can be calculated as CSS width + CSS padding - height of vertical scrollbar (if present)
element.clientTop returns the width of the top border of an element, in pixels. does not include the element's top padding or top margin Has No Equivalent
element.clientLeft returns the width of the left border of an element, in pixels. does not include the element's top padding or top margin Has No Equivalent
element.scrollHeight returns in pixels : ENTIRE content & padding (visible or not) | but not the border, scrollbar or margin. Has No Equivalent
element.scrollWidth returns in pixels : ENTIRE content & padding (visible or not) | but not the border, scrollbar or margin. Has No Equivalent
element.scrollTop sets or returns the number of pixels an element's content is scrolled vertically. .scrollTop()
element.scrollLeft sets or returns the number of pixels an element's content is scrolled horizontally. .scrollLeft()
element.offsetHeight returns in pixels : VISIBLE content & padding + border + scrollbar | but not the margin. .outerHeight(margin[true|false])
element.offsetWidth returns in pixels : VISIBLE content & padding + border + scrollbar | but not the margin. .outerWidth(margin[true|false])
element.offsetTop returns the top position (in pixels) relative to the top of the offsetParent element. .position().top .offset().top : returns the top position relative to the DOCUMENT
element.offsetLeft returns the left position (in pixels) relative to the left of the offsetParent element. .position().left .offset().left : returns the left position relative to the DOCUMENT
Changing Elements Styleelement.style.property=new style Full Reference
HTML DOM Events
onload The event occurs when an object has loaded .load(myfunc)
onscroll The event occurs when an element's scrollbar is being scrolled .scroll(myfunc)
onresize The event occurs when an element's scrollbar is being resized .resize(myfunc)
onfocus The event occurs when an element gets focus .focus(myfunc)
onsubmit The event occurs when a form is submitted .submit(myfunc)
onclick The event occurs when the user clicks on an element .click(myfunc)
ondblclick The event occurs when the user double-clicks on an element .dblclick(myfunc)
onmouseenter The event occurs when the pointer is moved onto an element .mouseenter(myfunc)
onkeydown The event occurs when the user is pressing a key .keydown(myfunc)
onkeypress The event occurs when the user presses a key .keypress(myfunc)
onkeyup The event occurs when the user releases a key .keyup(myfunc)
-= Full Events =-
element.addEventListener(event, function, useCapture) Attaches an event handler to the specified element ||useCapture->true : the event is first captured by the outermost element and propagated to the inner elements.||useCapture-> false : the event is first captured and handled by the innermost element and then propagated to outer elements.(Bubbling) .on(event, selector, handler)
element.removeEventListener(event, function, useCapture) Removes an event handler that has been attached with the addEventListener() method .off(event, selector, handler)

Browser Object Model

Window Object
Method Description jQuery Equivalent
Window Object Properties
innerWidth Returns the inner width of a window's content area without toolbars/scrollbars. $(window).width()
innerHeight Returns the inner height of a window's content area without toolbars/scrollbars. $(window).height()
outerWidth Returns the outer width of a window, including toolbars/scrollbars jQuery Has Not outerWidth Property that include toolbars/scrollbars !!!
outerHeight Returns the outer Height of a window, including toolbars/scrollbars jQuery Has Not outerHeight Property Equivalent that include toolbars/scrollbars !!!
pageXOffset Returns the pixels the current document has been scrolled (horizontally) from the upper left corner of the window .scrollLeft()
pageYOffset Returns the pixels the current document has been scrolled (vertically) from the upper left corner of the window .scrollTop()
Window Object Methods
alert("..\n..") Displays an alert box with a message and an OK button alert("..\n..")
confirm("..\n..") Displays a dialog box with a message and an OK and a Cancel button confirm("..\n..")
prompt(text,defaultText) Displays a dialog box that prompts the visitor for input prompt(text,defaultText)
scrollBy(Xnum, Ynum) Scrolls the document by the specified number of pixels a Tricky way
scrollTo(Xnum, Ynum) Scrolls the document to the specified coordinates
stop() Stops the window from loading
close() Closes the current window
focus() Sets focus to the current window
open() Opens a new browser window
setInterval() Calls a function or evaluates an expression at specified intervals (in milliseconds)
clearInterval() Clears a timer set with setInterval()
setTimeout() Calls a function or evaluates an expression after a specified number of milliseconds
clearTimeout() Clears a timer set with setTimeout()
Window.Screen Object
Method Description jQuery Equivalent
Screen Object Properties
screen.width Returns the total width of the screen
screen.height Returns the total height of the screen
screen.availWidth Returns the width of the screen (excluding the Windows Taskbar)
screen.availHeight Returns the height of the screen (excluding the Windows Taskbar)
screen.colorDepth Returns the bit depth of the color palette for displaying images

Location Object Properties

location.hash Sets or returns the anchor part (#) of a URL http://www.Maged-M.Com/fullJsRef/BOM.php#Location
Location Object Methods
location.assign(URL) Loads a new document Click Me
location.replace(URL) Replaces the current document with a new one can't go back in history like assign() method Click Me
location.reload(forceGET) default: false Reloads the current document if you want hard reload from the server not from a cache -> location.reload(true) Click Me
Window.History Object
Method Description Example
History Object Properties
history.length Returns the number of URLs in the history list Click to Show History Length
History Object Methods
history.back() Loads the previous URL in the history list
history.forward() Loads the next URL in the history list
history.go( number +/- | URL ) Loads a specific URL from the history list
Window.Navigator Object
Method Description Example
Navigator Object Properties
navigator.appCodeName Returns the code name of the browser
navigator.appName Returns the name of the browser
navigator.appVersion Returns the version information of the browser
navigator.cookieEnabled Determines whether cookies are enabled in the browser
navigator.geolocation Returns a Geolocation object that can be used to locate the user's position
navigator.language Returns the language of the browser
navigator.onLine Determines whether the browser is online
navigator.platform Returns for which platform the browser is compiled
navigator.product Returns the engine name of the browser
navigator.userAgent Returns the user-agent header sent by the browser to the server
Navigator Object Methods
history.back() Loads the previous URL in the history list
history.forward() Loads the next URL in the history list
history.go( number +/- | URL ) Loads a specific URL from the history list
Cookies
Cookies are data, stored in small text files, on your computer.
When a web server has sent a web page to a browser, the connection is shut down, and the server forgets everything about the user.
Method Description Example
document.cookie = "Cookie;expires=Exp.Date;Path" Set or Get Cookie of the document document.cookie = "username=maged;expires=09 April 2033 UTC;path=/"
document.cookie = "..;expires= 1970;.." To Delete a Cookie set the expires parameter to a passed date document.cookie = "username=maged;expires=09 April 1996 UTC;path=/"
